intro: Argythamnia illimaniensis, commonly known as the Andean sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Argythamnia illimaniensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
